name: CFMoto 150SC
description: The CFMoto 150SC is a premium maxi-scooter that combines sporty styling with practical urban mobility. Designed for riders who want performance and comfort, it features a liquid-cooled 150cc engine that delivers smooth power delivery. The aerodynamic bodywork, full LED lighting, and Bluetooth-enabled digital dashboard give it a modern edge. With its comfortable ergonomics and 10-liter fuel tank, it's perfect for daily commuting while offering weekend fun with its peppy acceleration.
suspension: Front telescopic fork, Rear dual shocks

faqs.question: What is the real-world mileage of CFMoto 150SC?
faqs.answer: Expect 35-38 kmpl under normal riding conditions in city traffic.

faqs.question: Does it have storage space under the seat?
faqs.answer: Yes, but limited to about 20 liters - enough for a half-face helmet.

faqs.question: Is the Bluetooth connectivity useful?
faqs.answer: Yes, it allows call alerts, message notifications and music control through the digital cluster.

faqs.question: What's the service interval?
faqs.answer: First service at 500km, then every 3000km or 4 months.

name: CFMoto 250NK
description: The CFMoto 250NK is a streetfighter that brings aggressive styling and performance to the 250cc segment. Its liquid-cooled engine produces 26.5 PS of power, making it one of the most powerful in its class. The inverted front forks, ABS-equipped front brake, and lightweight chassis offer confident handling. With full LED lighting and a digital display, it combines modern technology with raw street presence. The comfortable yet sporty ergonomics make it suitable for both city commuting and weekend rides.

faqs.question: How does it compare to KTM 250 Duke?
faqs.answer: The 250NK offers similar performance at a lower price point but with fewer premium components.

faqs.question: Is the ABS switchable?
faqs.answer: No, the ABS is fixed and cannot be turned off.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 795mm seat height accommodates most riders up to 6 feet comfortably.

name: CFMoto 250SR
description: The CFMoto 250SR is a fully-faired sportbike that brings track-inspired performance to the streets. Its liquid-cooled 250cc engine delivers 27.5 PS of power through a smooth 6-speed gearbox. The aerodynamic fairing, aggressive riding position, and premium suspension components make it a true sportbike experience. Features like LED lighting, TFT display, and ABS-equipped front brake add modern appeal. Whether you're carving corners or commuting, the 250SR offers thrilling performance with everyday usability.

faqs.question: Is this suitable for beginners?
faqs.answer: Yes, though the aggressive riding position may take some getting used to.

faqs.question: What's the fuel range?
faqs.answer: About 300-350km per tank depending on riding style.

faqs.question: Does it have a slipper clutch?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with a standard wet multi-plate clutch.

faqs.question: How does it compare to Yamaha R15?
faqs.answer: The 250SR has more power and features but is slightly heavier.

name: CFMoto 250CL-C
description: The CFMoto 250CL-C brings classic cruiser styling to the 250cc segment with its teardrop fuel tank, low-slung profile, and relaxed ergonomics. Powered by a liquid-cooled 250cc engine, it offers smooth power delivery perfect for laid-back cruising. The low 700mm seat height makes it accessible to all riders, while the 15-liter fuel tank ensures good range. Chrome accents, LED lighting, and spoke wheels complete the classic cruiser look. Whether you're commuting or weekend cruising, the 250CL-C offers comfortable, stylish transportation.
suspension: Front telescopic fork, Rear dual shocks
pros: Low seat height for easy handling

faqs.question: Is this suitable for highway cruising?
faqs.answer: Yes, though it's more comfortable at moderate speeds of 80-90 km/h.

faqs.question: Can it accommodate a pillion comfortably?
faqs.answer: Yes, the wide saddle seat provides decent comfort for two.

faqs.question: Does it have customization potential?
faqs.answer: Yes, the classic cruiser design lends itself well to customization.

name: CFMoto 300SR
description: The CFMoto 300SR is a high-performance supersport that brings 300cc power to the sportbike segment. Its liquid-cooled engine produces 31.5 PS, delivered through a precise 6-speed gearbox. The full fairing design isn't just for looks - it provides real aerodynamic benefits at speed. Premium components include inverted front forks, monoshock rear suspension, and dual-channel ABS. The aggressive riding position, lightweight chassis, and sticky tires make it equally capable on twisty roads or track days. With features like LED lighting and TFT display, it's a modern sportbike with serious performance credentials.

faqs.question: Is this suitable for track days?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 300SR is track-capable with its sporty geometry and suspension.

faqs.question: How does it compare to Ninja 300?
faqs.answer: Similar performance but with more modern features at a lower price point.

faqs.question: What's the service interval?
faqs.answer: Every 4000km or 6 months, whichever comes first.

faqs.question: Does it have a slipper clutch?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with a standard wet multi-plate clutch.

name: CFMoto 230 Dual
description: The CFMoto 230 Dual is a versatile dual-sport motorcycle equally at home on city streets or dirt trails. Its 230cc air-cooled engine provides reliable power with excellent fuel efficiency. The long-travel suspension, high ground clearance, and spoke wheels with knobby tires make it capable off-road, while the comfortable upright riding position works well for daily commuting. Features like LED headlight, digital display, and 14-liter fuel tank add practicality. Whether you're navigating urban traffic or exploring backroads, the 230 Dual offers accessible adventure.

faqs.question: Is this suitable for complete beginners?
faqs.answer: Yes, the manageable power and upright position make it beginner-friendly.

faqs.question: What's the real-world fuel consumption?
faqs.answer: Expect about 35-40 kmpl under normal riding conditions.

faqs.question: Can it handle highway speeds?
faqs.answer: It can maintain 80-90 km/h comfortably but isn't ideal for extended highway use.

name: Lifan 150T-13
short_description: Lifan 150T-13 - A basic 150cc commuter bike with simple design, reliable performance and low maintenance costs.

name: Lifan Blink 125
short_description: Lifan Blink 125 - A stylish 125cc commuter bike with modern design elements, comfortable ergonomics and decent performance.

name: Lifan K19
short_description: Lifan K19 - A stylish 165cc cruiser with classic bobber-inspired design, comfortable riding position and relaxed performance.

name: Lifan KPR 165 EFI
short_description: Lifan KPR 165 EFI - A fuel-injected 165cc sports bike with improved performance, better fuel efficiency, and modern styling for young riders.

faqs.question: What is EFI?
faqs.answer: Electronic Fuel Injection for better performance and fuel efficiency

name: Lifan KPR 165R Carburetor
short_description: Lifan KPR 165R Carburetor - A 165cc carbureted sports bike with race-inspired design, aggressive styling, and punchy performance for budget-conscious riders.

faqs.question: Carburetor vs EFI?
faqs.answer: Carburetor is simpler but less efficient than EFI

name: Lifan KPR 165R CBS
short_description: Lifan KPR 165R CBS - A 165cc sports bike with Combined Braking System (CBS) for enhanced safety, sporty ergonomics, and premium features at an affordable price.

faqs.question: What is CBS?
faqs.answer: Combined Braking System that distributes braking force between both wheels

name: Lifan KPR 200 4V
short_description: Lifan KPR 200 4V - A powerful 200cc 4-valve sports bike with aggressive styling, premium features, and thrilling performance for enthusiast riders.

faqs.question: What does 4V mean?
faqs.answer: 4-valve technology for better airflow and performance

faqs.question: Is this suitable for touring?
faqs.answer: Yes, with its 6-speed gearbox and comfortable ergonomics

name: Lifan KPR150 CBS
short_description: Lifan KPR150 CBS - A 150cc sports commuter with Combined Braking System for safer stopping, sporty aesthetics, and comfortable ergonomics for daily riding.
build_quality: Entry-level sports bike with safety features

faqs.question: What is CBS?
faqs.answer: Combined Braking System that links front and rear brakes for better stopping power

name: Lifan KPT 150
short_description: Lifan KPT 150 - A 150cc adventure tourer with upright riding position, long-travel suspension, and touring capabilities for Bangladeshi roads.

faqs.question: Is this suitable for off-road?
faqs.answer: Light off-road only, primarily an adventure-styled tourer

name: Lifan KPT 150 4V
short_description: Lifan KPT 150 4V - A premium 150cc 4-valve adventure tourer with enhanced performance, touring features, and rugged styling for long-distance riders.

faqs.question: What does 4V mean?
faqs.answer: 4-valve technology for better airflow and performance

faqs.question: Is this suitable for two-up touring?
faqs.answer: Yes, with comfortable pillion seat and good torque

name: Lifan KPV 150
short_description: Lifan KPV 150 - A unique 150cc adventure-style maxi-scooter with rugged design, long-travel suspension, and practical features for urban commuting and light touring.

faqs.question: Is this automatic?
faqs.answer: Yes, it uses a CVT automatic transmission

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, single-channel ABS on front wheel

name: Lifan KPV 150 ABS
short_description: Lifan KPV 150 ABS - A rugged 150cc adventure scooter with single-channel ABS, water-cooled engine, and off-road inspired design for urban explorers and weekend adventurers.

faqs.question: ABS on both wheels?
faqs.answer: No, single-channel ABS only on front wheel

name: Lifan KPV 150 Queen & Youth Edition
short_description: Lifan KPV 150 Queen & Youth Edition - A premium 150cc adventure scooter with special edition styling, dual-channel ABS, and enhanced features for style-conscious riders.
cons: Special edition parts may be costly

faqs.question: What's special about this edition?
faqs.answer: Unique colors, dual ABS, and premium finishes

name: Lifan Razor 100
short_description: Lifan Razor 100 - An affordable 100cc commuter bike with rugged styling, fuel-efficient engine, and low maintenance costs for daily city riding.

faqs.answer: Light off-road only, primarily for bad roads
